summary: This document is an email forwarding a sealed letter motion, affidavit, and exhibits from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to Judge Nathan, requesting modification of a protective order in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, whose defense team is filing a sealed motion to modify a protective order.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: The sender of the email forwarding the sealed motion and exhibits from the law firm Haddon, Morgan to Judge Nathan.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: A defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who requested the filing of the sealed letter motion and accompanying documents.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: A defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the email regarding the sealed filing.

persons.name: Ann Lundber
persons.context: An individual copied on the email regarding the sealed filing, likely part of the legal team.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The presiding judge (Alison J. Nathan) in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the sealed motion is addressed.

connections.description: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca is a defense attorney filing a motion on behalf of his client, Ghislaine Maxwell.
Laura Menninger is a defense attorney copied on correspondence regarding the sealed motion for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are associated with the law firm Haddon, Morgan, working on Ghislaine Maxwell's defense.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judge in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Filing of Sealed Motion to Modify Protective Order
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files a letter motion, affidavit, and exhibits under seal requesting modification of a protective order in her criminal case.

keyFacts: On August 17, 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a sealed motion to modify a protective order in her criminal case.
The motion was filed by attorney Jeffrey S. Pagliuca and forwarded to Judge Alison J. Nathan by Nicole Simmons of the law firm Haddon, Morgan.
The filing indicates ongoing legal proceedings and defense strategy discussions in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
